byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and FALIH HASSAN

abstract: United Nations issues report saying that almost 19,000 people in Iraq have were killed and more than three million displaced from January 2014, when Islamic State first started taking territory, to October 2015.
lead_paragraph: A report says that from January 2014, when ISIS started taking territory, to October 2015, nearly 19,000 people were killed and more than three million displaced.

headline.main: U.N. Quantifies the Suffering in an Iraq Divided and Under Attack
headline.print_headline: U.N. Quantifies the Deep Suffering in an Iraq Divided and Under Attack

snippet: A report says that from January 2014, when ISIS started taking territory, to October 2015, nearly 19,000 people were killed and more than three million displaced.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
